error.thresholdTooHigh: Thresholds must not exceed the sum of weights.

multisigCreate.title: Create account (optional multisig)
multisigCreate.menuHint: Create accounts for family members, friends, employees...
multisigCreate.hint: Create a new wallet. Optionally activate now (1 XLM or recommended) and add additional signers (multisig).

instructions.public: Public Key: Your account address, like an IBAN. Safe to share.
instructions.secret: Secret Key: Your password for the account. Never share, store securely (e.g., on paper).

multisigCreate.signersInfo: Add G... addresses as co-signers. Each signer increases the minimum reserve.
multisigCreate.thresholdHelp: Threshold: number of required signatures (master + co-signers) for a transaction to be valid.
multisigCreate.thresholdLevelsHint: Typical: low = simple changes (e.g., memo/price), medium = payments/trades, high = security-critical (e.g., signers/thresholds)
multisigCreate.thresholdCurrent: Current selection: low={{low}}, medium={{med}}, high={{high}} of {{total}} signatures
multisigCreate.thresholdTooHigh: Note: A threshold must not exceed the sum of weights. Please adjust the values.
multisigCreate.activateHint: Activation is required for the account to exist. On Testnet via Friendbot, on Mainnet via "Create Account" from an existing wallet.
multisigCreate.mainnetActivateNote: Note: Multisig requires additional reserves. 1 XLM often isn't enough.
multisigCreate.balanceWarning: Starting balance is likely too low to add the {{count}} additional signers (minimum reserve: {{req}} XLM)
multisigCreate.confirmLowBalance: Starting balance ({{bal}} XLM) is below minimum reserve ({{req}} XLM) for {{count}} additional signers. Continue anyway?
multisigCreate.signersCountHint: You set the minimum number of signatures below in "Required signatures" (low/medium/high).
multisigCreate.signersCountLimit: Note: Quick select up to 10. Manual input is possible. Network limit (Stellar): max 20 additional signers.

info.text:
How it works
Your secret key always remains in your browser. It is only used to sign your transaction locally. Only the final signature is sent to our server or outside, never your key. If you want, you can verify this with the browser developer tools: you can see that no key is transmitted.
info.multisig: Multisig means that more than one signature is required for this account. You choose additional signers and the threshold (e.g. 2 of 3). A transaction is valid only if at least the threshold number of signatures (master + co-signers) is present.

tooltips.masterWeight: Weight of the account owner (master). Contributes to the total weight.
tooltips.signerWeight: Weight of the respective co-signer (0–255). Contributes to the total weight.
tooltips.signerWeightHint: Note: Master and signer weights form the total; thresholds (low/medium/high) must not exceed this total.

bestPractices.title: Best practices
bestPractices.text: Recommended: 2 out of 3 signatures. This means: Out of a total of 3 signers (1 master + 2 co‑signers), at least 2 signatures are required. How to set it up: give master and each signer weight=1 and set thresholds to low=1, medium=2, high=2. This allows simple changes with 1 signature; payments/trades require 2; security‑critical changes require 2.

multisigCreate.createdNoSigners: Account created. No additional signers specified.
